intro: Myrsine semiserrata var. brachypoda, commonly known as the short-toothed myrsine, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to Southeast Asia and is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves with slightly serrated edges. The plant produces small, white to pinkish flowers that are clustered in cymes, followed by small, fleshy berries. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic studies.
